beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Your power-to-weight ratio matters here. Starting at nearly 5,000 feet with 6,000 feet of climbing creates substantial Sierra Nevada consequences. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. The 65-mile mid-distance hits the sweet spot with three options (35, 67, 100 miles) letting riders pick their suffering level. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Requires line choice. Rewards the attentive rider. Derek Yarra captures the technical reality: "As soon as the pavement ended, and the doubletrack dirt roads started, carnage ensued. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. Historical weather data shows average highs of 79°F and lows of 48°F, with a 19% chance of rain on any given day. Adventure. 3 out of 5. Genuine adventure elements. Expect the unexpected. Lost Sierra backcountry through ranchlands, mountain lakes, and Forest Service roads delivers remote terrain at serious elevation. Experience. 3 out of 5. You'll remember this one. Mostly fondly. Over 80% dirt through Lost Sierra backcountry, ranchlands, and forested valleys delivers adventure terrain. Community. 3 out of 5. Genuine community feel. People stick around. Serena Gordon emphasizes "the way the community embraces the event, and everyone's so nice, and the festival. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Basic setup. Don't expect hand-holding. Packet pickup only Friday 3pm-7pm or Saturday 6am-8am at Portola City Park shows minimal flexibility.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.
